parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear brakes can lead to extended stopping distances, accidents, and injuries, as the vehicle may not be able to stop in time.
symptoms: The rear brakes never touched the drums
the rear drums were in showroom condition
the vehicle pulled to the left when the brakes were applied.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS can cause the vehicle to lose control, leading to accidents, injuries, and fatalities.
symptoms: The ABS failed to stop the vehicle during an emergency stop
the ABS failed to engage during braking
the vehicle sped up when the brakes were applied.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The brake pedal and rotor issues can cause the vehicle to lose braking power, leading to extended stopping distances, accidents, and injuries.
symptoms: The brake pedal felt soft or spongy
the right front rotor was worn and had to be replaced
the brake pads were not worn unevenly
the braking system was not working properly.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The brake performance issues in wet conditions can cause the vehicle to lose control, leading to accidents, injuries, and fatalities.
symptoms: The brakes slipped and did not catch when it was raining
the brakes became hard and caused the vehicle to gradually stop

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The poorly placed gas and brake pedals can cause driver distraction, leading to accidents and injuries.
symptoms: The top part of the foot hit the steering column when moving from the gas pedal to the brake pedal.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A cracked intake manifold can cause coolant to leak into the exhaust system, leading to engine failure, stalling, and potentially causing accidents or injuries.
Engine stalling and hesitation can cause loss of power, making it difficult to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or injuries.
Cooling system failure can cause engine overheating, leading to engine damage, stalling, and potentially causing accidents or injuries.
Ignition system failure can cause engine hesitation, stalling, and difficulty accelerating, making it difficult to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or injuries.
Transmission and brake issues can cause difficulty shifting, loss of control, and accidents or injuries.
The sudden and uncontrolled increase in engine RPM can cause loss of vehicle control, overheating of brake linings, and potentially lead to accidents.
symptoms: The engine RPM suddenly increases to over 4000 RPM while cruising
making it difficult to control the vehicle's speed
and requiring the application of brakes to slow down.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The rough idle and difficulty in restarting the engine can cause inconvenience, anxiety, and potentially lead to stalling or loss of power in critical situations.
symptoms: The engine idles roughly when hot
and the vehicle may not restart for an extended period

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Pedal Placement and Emergency Braking Concerns
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The poorly placed gas and brake pedals can cause difficulty in transitioning between the two pedals, potentially leading to delayed or ineffective braking in emergency situations.
symptoms: The driver's foot hits the steering column when moving from the gas pedal to the brake pedal or vice versa
requiring excessive foot and leg movement.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Unusual Vehicle Behavior and Transmission Issues
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The unusual lurching or slipping sensation while slowing down can cause loss of vehicle control, anxiety, and potentially lead to accidents.
symptoms: The vehicle lurches or slips when slowing down
feeling like a tire has a bubble or the rear-end is slipping
